task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then grasp the spatula and push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top robot works with a pot that initially has a lid, a nearby plate (round coaster), and a spatula-like tool. The robot must first expose the pot’s contents by opening its lid. Next, it relocates the pot onto the plate. Finally, using the spatula as a tool, it pushes the pot toward the front edge of the workspace. The contact sheet shows the pot, plate, and tool positions and the robot’s approach and manipulation around them.
preconditions: Camera view includes pot, lid, plate, and spatula
Robot gripper functional and empty at start
Workspace clear to push pot forward
stepwise_plan: Perceive pot, lid, plate, and spatula.
Approach the pot and open its lid.
Grasp the pot from the side and lift slightly.
Move above the plate and place the pot on the plate.
Push the pot toward the front edge of the table.
success_criteria: Pot stably centered on the plate
Pot translated toward the table’s front edge by the push
failure_and_recovery: If lid opening fails: retry perception and re-approach before opening.
If grasp is unstable: reopen gripper, recompute grasp pose, and retry.
If placement drifts: re-align above plate and re-place.
If push slips: re-grasp spatula and repeat push.
task_long_description.termination: End when the pot is placed on the plate and has been pushed toward the front edge; tool released and arm idle.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact near the pot and lid area with alignment toward the object cluster.
frame_3.predicts_next: Suggests imminent manipulation—either lid opening or grasping.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Detect a named object in the scene.
Move above the target with a vertical offset.
Open a container or its lid.
Compute a grasp pose and store it on the blackboard.
Execute a grasp using a stored pose.
Close the gripper with specified force.
Lift the held object a short distance.
Place the object onto a named surface/area.
Open gripper to a set width.
Push a target using a specified handheld tool.

failure_modes: Lid not detected or opening motion misaligned
Push direction not toward table front
recovery_strategy: Recompute grasp pose with alternate strategy and retry close
Lift and re-place with lower press force
Regrasp spatula and repeat push with corrected direction
assumptions: The tool in frames is a spatula; it is used for pushing.
Table front corresponds to the image bottom; push uses direction_deg=180.
OpenContainer with container_type="lid" models removing the pot lid without needing a lid grasp action.
